publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Dana Carleton Munro (1866-1933) was a historian and influential scholar of the Crusades. He taught at the University of Pennsylvania from 1893-1902 and at the University of Wisconsin from 1902-1915. He then joined the faculty of Princeton University, where he was the chair of the history department from 1916-1928 and the first Dodge Professor of History. He published a number of texts on the Middle Ages and medieval civilization, including A History of the Middle Ages (1902).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of notes and course materials by or related to Dana Carleton Munro. Materials include: notes of Dana Carleton Munro, chiefly student notes from the University of Strasbourg, 1889-1890; George L. Burr's reader's notes on Munro's textbook A History of the Middle Ages, 1913-1921 (manuscript notes and typed transcript); and syllabi and lecture lists for courses on the Crusades taught by J. L. LaMonte (the courses used Munro's works) from 1948.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Formerly in the Lea Collection
